intro: Conyza grandis, commonly known as the greater ironweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in open areas such as fields and roadsides, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. Conyza grandis is known for its ability to adapt to various soil types and is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
